code: @Manual{,   title = {rvg: R Graphics Devices for 'Office' Vector Graphics Output},   author = {David Gohel},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.4.1},   url = {https://ardata-fr.github.io/officeverse/}, }

what: R Graphics Devices for Office Vector Graphics Output
title: R Graphics Devices for Office Vector Graphics Output
text: rvg provides two graphics devices produce Vector Graphics outputs DrawingML format Microsoft PowerPoint dml_pptx Microsoft Excel dml_xlsx. formats let users edit graphic elements (editable graphics) within PowerPoint Excel good rendering. raw XML outputs used . Functions dml ph_with() used package officer add vector graphics PowerPoint documents (dml function simple wrapper mark plot instructions Vector Graphics instructions). Function xl_add_vg() equivalent Excel workbooks. default, graphics editable, element edition can disabled option editable = FALSE.
code: library(rvg) library(ggplot2) library(officer)  my_vec_graph <- dml(code = barplot(1:5, col = 2:6))  doc <- read_pptx() doc <- add_slide(doc, layout = "Title and Content", master = "Office Theme") doc <- ph_with(doc, my_vec_graph, location = ph_location_fullsize() ) print(doc, target = "my_plot.pptx") doc <- read_xlsx() doc <- xl_add_vg(doc, sheet = "Feuil1", code = print(gg),    width = 6, height = 6, left = 1, top = 2 ) print(doc, target = "vg.xlsx")

title: Wrap plot instructions for DrawingML plotting in Powerpoint — dml

Note: output vector graphic, native Microsoft Office chart. underlying data embedded document.

title: Wrap plot instructions for DrawingML plotting in Powerpoint — dml
text: dealing ggplot object, bg parameter sets device background ggplot theme's plot.background typically draw . control background appearance, set theme instead:

title: Wrap plot instructions for DrawingML plotting in Powerpoint — dml
text: DrawingML format support following R graphics features: Patterns gradients: grid patterns (GridPattern), linear radial gradients used fill translated DrawingML. ggplot2 emit warning used. Rich text (ggtext/gridtext): packages ggtext render HTML/Markdown composite grid grobs. rvg device can capture low-level primitives (text strings, lines, polygons), rich formatting (inline images, coloured spans, HTML markup) lost. Use standard ggplot2 text functions apply formatting export PowerPoint. Plotmath expressions: R's graphics engine decomposes expression() individual text primitives device sees . Compound expressions (e.g. expression("" * "b"), superscripts, subscripts) rendered separate text boxes, causing vertical misalignment. Clipping paths, masks, compositing transformations: R >= 4.1 features DrawingML equivalent silently ignored.

title: Wrap plot instructions for DrawingML plotting in Powerpoint — dml
code: anyplot <- dml(code = barplot(1:5, col = 2:6), bg = "wheat")  library(officer) doc <- read_pptx() doc <- add_slide(doc, "Title and Content", "Office Theme") doc <- ph_with(doc, anyplot, location = ph_location_fullsize()) fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx") # fileout <- "vg.pptx" print(doc, target = fileout)

title: DrawingML graphic device for Microsoft PowerPoint — dml_pptx
code: dml_pptx(   file = "Rplots.dml",   width = 6,   height = 6,   offx = 1,   offy = 1,   bg = "white",   fonts = list(),   pointsize = 12,   editable = TRUE,   id = 1L,   last_rel_id = 1L,   raster_prefix = "raster_",   standalone = TRUE )

title: DrawingML graphic device for Microsoft PowerPoint — dml_pptx
text: file file output appear. height, width Height width inches. offx, offy top left origin plot bg Default background color plot (defaults "white"). fonts Named list font names aliased fonts installed system. unspecified, R default families sans, serif, mono symbol aliased families detected gdtools::font_set_auto(). Important: fonts referenced name DrawingML output embedded. reader PowerPoint file must also fonts installed, otherwise Office substitute . maximum portability, prefer fonts bundled Microsoft Office "Arial", "Times New Roman" "Courier New". Fonts must installed system; use gdtools::font_family_exists() verify availability. Example: list(sans = "Arial", serif = "Times New Roman", mono = "Courier New"). pointsize default point size. editable vector graphics elements (points, text, etc.) editable. id specifies unique identifier (integer) within slide contain DrawingML instructions. last_rel_id specifies last unique identifier (integer) within relationship file used reference embedded raster images . raster_prefix string value used prefix png files produced raster objects printed graphical device. standalone produce standalone drawingml file? FALSE, omits xml header namespaces.

title: add a plot output as vector graphics into an Excel object — xl_add_vg
text: x rxlsx object produced officer::read_xlsx sheet sheet label/name code plot instructions left, top left top origin plot sheet inches. height, width Height width inches. ... arguments passed dml_xlsx.

title: add a plot output as vector graphics into an Excel object — xl_add_vg
code: # \donttest{ library(officer) my_ws <- read_xlsx() my_ws <- xl_add_vg(my_ws,   sheet = "Feuil1",   code = barplot(1:5, col = 2:6), width = 6, height = 6, left = 1, top = 2 ) fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".xlsx") print(my_ws, target = fileout) # }

title: rvg 0.4.1
text: Text longer inherits bold/italic style PowerPoint/Excel templates; b attributes now always set explicitly run properties. Shapes without fill now emit explicit <:noFill/> instead omitting fill element, preventing unintended theme fill inheritance PowerPoint/Excel. Circles (points) outside clipping region now skipped, preventing data points appearing beyond plot limits. Text longer vertically shifted PowerPoint/Excel output; removed explicit line spacing conflicted centered anchor text boxes.

title: rvg 0.4.1
text: dml_xlsx() longer exposes raster_prefix argument; raster files now written internal temporary directory. prefix embedded output XML comment (<!-- rvg_raster_prefix:... -->), callers can read dev.() locate PNG files. Implement xlsx_path callback XLSX device, enabling geom_path path-based geometries Excel output. Compound paths (pptx_path/xlsx_path) now combine sub-polygons single <:path> element within <:custGeom>, holes (donuts, cut-polygons) render correctly via winding rule. Bump deviceVersion v15 (R_GE_group) R >= 4.2, avoiding redundant double-clipping graphics engine enabling capabilities callback dev.capabilities() reports explicitly unsupported features (patterns, masks, clipping paths, compositing, transformations). eliminates “Unable check capabilities” warning ggplot2. Font resolution now uses gdtools::font_set_auto() detect system fonts sans, serif, mono symbol aliases. Minimum gdtools version bumped 0.5.0. validate_fonts() now warns user-supplied font families found system. Documentation clarifies fonts embedded DrawingML output must available reader’s system.
